abstract.para:
In case of problems, a system report may be created using the supportconfig tool.
It will collect information about the system such as: current Kernel version, hardware, installed packages, partition setup and much more. The result is a TAR archive of files that will help Global Technical Support to assist or locate the issue you reported.

Additionally, you can analyze the supportconfig output for known issues to help resolve problems faster. For this purpose, &productname; provides both an appliance and a command line tool for Supportconfig Analysis (SCA).

step.para: Start &yast;.
Open the Support module.
Click Create report tarball.
In the next window, select one of the supportconfig options from the radio button list. If you want to test the report function first, use Only gather a minimum amount of info. Proceed with Next.
Enter your contact information. Use your service request number from and enter it into the text field labeled Novell 11 digit service request number. Proceed with Next.

Review the data collection. Use Remove from Data to remove any files you want excluded from the TAR archive uploaded to Novell. Continue with Next.

Save the tarball. By default, a copy of the tarball will be saved in /root. If you want to upload to the Novell customer center, make sure Upload log files tarball into URL is activated. sect2.title: Using Supportconfig Directly
sect2.para: To use supportconfig from the command line, proceed as follows:

step.para: Open a shell and become root.
Run supportconfig without any options. This gathers the default system information.
Wait for the tool to complete the operation.
The default archive location is /var/log with the filename format nts_HOST_DATE_TIME.tbz
